content.rendered:
Euclidteers Unite!

We recognize that retirement is a world-changing event for many of our clients. Our goal to support you throughout that transition extends beyond finances. Join us at any of our various events to meet other Euclidteers just like you!

Community is at the CORE of everything
we do at Euclid Financial Services.

When the time comes to retire, it can be almost as intimidating as it is exciting. Some retirees begin feeling lonely as they settle into their retirement and leave the weekly work routine behind.

Our goal is to help you to and through your entire retirement and all of the changes that go with it. That means our interest is for your total well-being through the transitions that occur during retirement, not just your financial standing. Our community is an integral part of everything we do here.

During retirement, you finally have more time to devote to your favorite hobbies. It is also the perfect time to explore new activities and develop new hobbies. Euclid has multiple clubs and programs to provide Euclidteers with opportunities and guidance during their retirement to explore and develop new routines.

Charity Events

  • We host charity events throughout the year to both benefit and bolster our community of Euclidteers from within.
  • Past events have featured DJs, live bands, celebrity impersonators, good food, plenty of prizes and giveaways, VIP tents for our clients, rentable exhibition booths and banner sponsorships, and so much more.
  • In the past we have worked with non-profit organizations such as Operation Stand Down, DCYF, RI Food Bank, P.A.R.L, Dana Farber Institute, and many more.

  • Euclid Sewing Club

  • Retirement Factory
    WordPlay Society

  • Euclid Cooking Club

  • Euclid Gardening Club

  • Euclid Crafting Club

  • Retirement Factory
    Dating Community

  • Euclid Choir

Euclid Sewing Club

Euclid Sewing Club

Join the Euclid Sewing Club and make a difference helping others in the community. Every year, Euclid Financial Services partners with a local organization to benefit the less fortunate. Enrich your life for a few hours a month by participating in this great opportunity to give back to your community and worthy military charities. If you have been looking to become a part of something bigger than yourself, join the Euclid team which stands together to help orphans, widows and soldiers.

  • Our Sewing Committee has made lap blankets benefitting the cancer patients of the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, and we’re calling all Euclidteers to volunteer and make donations toward similar projects!
  • We meet from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. every Monday and every other Saturday. Keep an eye on our newsletter for any updates regarding these meetings.
  • You have the option to pin, cut, sew or just donate—no special skills necessary!

We are still in need of materials and volunteers. Donations of the following would be most appreciated:

  • 150 yards of no-pill fleece, machine washable [No-pill fleece must be cut in even-numbered yards, minimum 4 yards]
  • 150 long ballpoint pins
  • Used sewing machines
Join Now
Join Our Facebook Group

Sewing Committee

The positions that we need to fill are:

  • Project Manager – The Project Manager will make sure we are meeting our deadlines for each project.
  • Treasure – The Treasure will be in charge of keeping track of all donations for the club. Fundraising – all monies received must be documented and delivered to an EFS representative as well as marked for the sewing club as donations.
  • Inventory Controller – The Inventory Controller will keep track of all supplies needed for projects. This role will also request purchases for goods or supplies through the EFS representative and marked for sewing club donation.
  • Membership Coordinator – The Membership Coordinator will be in charge of the calendaring, recruiting as well as the health and safety of members. This position will also be charged with reminding the club of its community service outreach programs.

There is no experience necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at 401.727.2727. We can’t wait to hear from you.

Retirement Factory
WordPlay Society

Retirement Factory
WordPlay Society

Do you like whimsical word games and brain teasers like crossword puzzles, Sudoku and Mad Libs? Do you love writing short stories, novels, or poetry? Join the Euclid Writing Club and become a member of the WordPlay Society today!

Club activities:

  • Book clubs
  • Editing and proofreading committee
  • Opportunities to share literary works in the form of memoir, short stories, fiction, non-fiction, novels and poetry
  • Publishing opportunities

We are still in need of materials and volunteers. 

Calling all Euclidteers!
Euclid Financial Services is writing a new book and is looking for 20 volunteers to help us edit and proofread. Euclid is currently writing a manuscript titled "The Retiree’s Retirement Guide: Ready To Be Ready" and would like you to join our editing and proofreading team.

You’ll work in tandem with the authors on each of the book’s four sections, to provide your honest and brutal feedback utilizing your technical writing and editing skills, and individual perspective.

There's no need to worry if your already feeling like this is a daunting task. We’ll provide you detailed instructions for you to follow. 

How Would I Benefit?

All volunteers who peer review all four sections of "The Retiree's Retirement Guide: Ready To Be Ready" will:

  • Receive a free, autographed copy once the book is published 
  • Have their name in the book on a dedication page
  • Be part of a team of passionate writers and storytellers
  • Be the first to read a potential bestseller
  • Share their opinion with hundreds of readers
Join Now
Join Our Facebook Group

Retirement Factory WordPlay Society Committee

The positions that we need to fill are:

  • Project Manager – The Project Manager will make sure we are meeting our deadlines for each project.
  • Treasure – The Treasure will be in charge of keeping track of all donations for the club. Fundraising – all monies received must be documented and delivered to an EFS representative as well as marked for the Retirement Factory Retirement Factory WordPlay Society as donations.
  • Inventory Controller – The Inventory Controller will keep track of all supplies needed for projects. This role will also request purchases for goods or supplies through the EFS representative and marked for Retirement Factory Retirement Factory WordPlay Society donation.
  • Membership Coordinator – The Membership Coordinator will be in charge of the calendaring, recruiting as well as the health and safety of members. This positioned will also be charged with reminding the club of its community service outreach programs.

There is no experience is necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at (401)727-2727. We can’t wait to hear for you.

Euclid Cooking Club

Cooking Club

For our Euclidteers who love to cook or want to experiment and improve their skills, the cooking club creates a community of retirees who love food. Join our club for lessons, cook offs, and opportunities to share recipes and learn from others. You can also be involved through our cooking club community blog.

Legacy Cook Book: Have you ever wanted your favorite recipe published? Euclid is completing our Legacy Cookbook and we need your help in gathering up more recipes.

Once it’s complete, you’ll get a copy of the Euclid Cookbook, so check this one off your bucket-list!

We’re encouraging all of you who love to cook, and or love to try new things to send in your favorite family recipe along with a picture that best describes you, your family, or the recipe.

We are still in need of materials and volunteers. Donations of the following would be most appreciated:

  • Loved family recipes
Join Now
Join Our Facebook Group

Cooking Club Committee

The positions that we need to fill are:

  • Project Manager – The Project Manager will make sure we are meeting our deadlines for each project.
  • Treasure – The Treasure will be in charge of keeping track of all donations for the club. Fundraising – all monies received must be documented and delivered to an EFS representative as well as marked for the Cooking club as donations.
  • Inventory Controller – The Inventory Controller will keep track of all supplies needed for projects. This role will also request purchases for goods or supplies through the EFS representative and marked for Cooking club donation.
  • Membership Coordinator – The Membership Coordinator will be in charge of the calendaring, recruiting as well as the health and safety of members. This positioned will also be charged with reminding the club of its community service outreach programs.

There is no experience is necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at (401)727-2727. We can’t wait to hear for you.

Euclid Gardening Club

Gardening Club

Gardening is the perfect activity to enrich the caretaker in you. Being able to carefully care for and nourish a garden into something beautiful can be immensely fulfilling. If you searching for a new way to explore your more artistic side, or if you already have a green thumb, the gardening club can be a community in which you thrive.

Socialize and work in a group setting with our community garden. Work with club members to design and care for the garden throughout the seasons.

For your at home garden, the club community blog will serve as a space to share ideas, ask for advice, learn from others, or simply boast about a beautiful project you’ve been working on.

  • Our Gardening Club maintains community gardens, and we’re calling all Euclidteers for volunteers and donations for similar projects!
  • We meet every other Saturday. Keep an eye on our newsletter for any updates regarding these meetings.
  • You have the option to plant, weed, dig, or just donate—no special skills necessary!

We are still in need of materials and volunteers. Donations of the following would be most appreciated:

  • 150 yards of mulch
  • Plants of all varieties
  • Used gardening equipment
  • Gardening gloves (All sizes)
Join Now
Join Our Facebook Group

Gardening Club Committee

The positions that we need to fill are:

  • Project Manager – The Project Manager will make sure we are meeting our deadlines for each project.
  • Treasure – The Treasure will be in charge of keeping track of all donations for the club. Fundraising – all monies received must be documented and delivered to an EFS representative as well as marked for the Gardening club as donations.
  • Inventory Controller – The Inventory Controller will keep track of all supplies needed for projects. This role will also request purchases for goods or supplies through the EFS representative and marked for Gardening club donation.
  • Membership Coordinator – The Membership Coordinator will be in charge of the calendaring, recruiting as well as the health and safety of members. This positioned will also be charged with reminding the club of its community service outreach programs.

There is no experience is necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at (401)727-2727. We can’t wait to hear for you.

Euclid Crafting Club

Crafting Club

Ever get sick of the same old holiday decorations that you use year after year? Tune into your creative side and join the Crafting club, where you can learn to make beautiful winter wreaths, festive fall table pieces and more seasonal decorations to liven up your living spaces.

Keep up with the Crafting Club Community blog to share ideas and pictures of your finished projects on display.

  • Our Crafting Club has made Christmas wreaths and Poinsettias as well as indoor fall decorations, and we’re calling all Euclidteers for volunteers and donations for similar projects!
  • Keep an eye on our newsletter for any updates regarding these meetings.
  • You have the option to make handmade crafts with an expert or just donate—no special skills necessary!

We are still in need of materials and volunteers. Donations of the following would be most appreciated:

  • Crafting materials
Join Now
Join Our Facebook Group

Crafting Committee

The positions that we need to fill are:

  • Project Manager – The Project Manager will make sure we are meeting our deadlines for each project.
  • Treasure – The Treasure will be in charge of keeping track of all donations for the club. Fundraising – all monies received must be documented and delivered to an EFS representative as well as marked for the Crafting club as donations.
  • Inventory Controller – The Inventory Controller will keep track of all supplies needed for projects. This role will also request purchases for goods or supplies through the EFS representative and marked for Crafting club donation.
  • Membership Coordinator – The Membership Coordinator will be in charge of the calendaring, recruiting as well as the health and safety of members. This positioned will also be charged with reminding the club of its community service outreach programs.

There is no experience is necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at (401)727-2727. We can’t wait to hear for you.

Retirement Factory
Dating Community

Retirement Factory Dating Community

Retirement can be some of the best years of your life, and it’s never too late to step back into the dating world and find a partner to share your time with. People at every stage of life can experience nerves when trying to navigate the dating world.

The Euclid Retirement Factory Dating Community is here to support you through that process and give you the confidence and skills you need when it comes to the new world of online dating.

  • Our Euclid Retirement Factory Dating Community is made up of retirees that range in age from 55- 80.
  • Keep an eye on our newsletter for any updates regarding these meetings.
  • You have the option to create dating profiles, discuss online dating etiquette, and receive expert support —no special skills necessary!

We are still in need of materials and volunteers. Donations of the following would be most appreciated:

  • Camera equipment
  • Used computers/laptops
Join Now
Join Our Facebook Group

Dating Committee

The positions that we need to fill are:

  • Project Manager – The Project Manager will make sure we are meeting our deadlines for each project.
  • Treasure – The Treasure will be in charge of keeping track of all donations for the club. Fundraising – all monies received must be documented and delivered to an EFS representative as well as marked for the Retirement Factory Dating Community as donations.
  • Inventory Controller – The Inventory Controller will keep track of all supplies needed for projects. This role will also request purchases for goods or supplies through the EFS representative and marked for Retirement Factory Dating Community donation.
  • Membership Coordinator – The Membership Coordinator will be in charge of the calendaring, recruiting as well as the health and safety of members. This positioned will also be charged with reminding the club of its community service outreach programs.

There is no experience is necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at (401)727-2727. We can’t wait to hear for you.

Euclid Choir

Euclid Choir

Some of our retirees have always dreamed of being on the radio.  Twice a year, including the holiday season, we bring together the Euclid Choir to record a selection of songs for a public radio broadcast.

The Euclid Choir Community is here to support you through that process and give you the confidence and skills you need when it comes to singing in a choir.

  • Our Euclid Choir Community is made up of retirees that range in age from 55- 80.
  • Keep an eye on our newsletter for any updates regarding these meetings.
  • You have the option to create beautiful music that will be used for advertising, station breaks, and general use—no special skills necessary!

We are still in need of materials and volunteers. Donations of the following would be most appreciated:

  • Earphones
  • Songbooks of all kinds
Join Now
Join Our Facebook Group

Euclid Choir

The positions that we need to fill are:

  • Project Manager – The Project Manager will make sure we are meeting our deadlines for each project.
  • Treasure – The Treasure will be in charge of keeping track of all donations for the club. Fundraising – all monies received must be documented and delivered to an EFS representative as well as marked for the Euclid Choir club as donations.
  • Inventory Controller – The Inventory Controller will keep track of all supplies needed for projects. This role will also request purchases for goods or supplies through the EFS representative and marked for Euclid Choir club donation.
  • Membership Coordinator – The Membership Coordinator will be in charge of the calendaring, recruiting as well as the health and safety of members. This positioned will also be charged with reminding the club of its community service outreach programs.

There is no experience is necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at (401)727-2727. We can’t wait to hear for you.

Join a Club!

“*” indicates required fields
What would you like to join?*
This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged.

Click on the club tab to join the Facebook Group for each individual club.

Seminars

  • We offer FREE public presentations on contemporary financial topics to help educate attendees on how to make informed financial decisions.
  • Learn how to increase your knowledge on topics like Medicare, Social Security benefits, different types of income and others.

There is no experience necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at 401.727.2727. We can’t wait to hear from you.

Advocate Program

  • Launched in 2014, the goals of the Advocate Program are spreading our community service ideals and ensuring that we at Euclid Financial Services are living up to them.
  • Members of the Advocate Program develop, guide and oversee our customer service development by identifying clients’ key interests and needs. Through the valued input of our clientele, we use this approach to continue building a strong company designed to exceed customers’ expectations.
  • If you are one of our valued clients and would like to participate in our Advocate Program, please contact us for further information.

There is no experience necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at 401.727.2727. We can’t wait to hear from you.

Appreciation Events

  • We continually strengthen relationships with our clientele by hosting small events year-round at various locations throughout Rhode Island and Massachusetts.
  • We know how difficult it can be to choose a firm to trust with your retirement planning, so we strive to show how highly we value the trust and loyalty of our community in return.
  • At our Appreciation Events, clients may enjoy music and giveaways, like raffle tickets to Red Sox, Bruins, Celtics, Patriots games, DJs, live bands, celebrity impersonators, good food, comedy clubs, VIP tents for our clients, rentable exhibition booths and banner sponsorships, and so much more.

There is no experience necessary. If you are interested in growing with our community, please call Euclid Financial Services at 401.727.2727. We can’t wait to hear from you.

Ready To Take

The Next Step?

For more information about any of our products and services, schedule a meeting today or tune in to The Retirement Factory.

Schedule a Meeting The Retirement Factory

meta._seopress_titles_title: Community | Plan For Your Future | Attend An Event
meta._seopress_titles_desc: Our financial advisors will help you develop strategies to prepare for unexpected medical expenses, ways to create income to help support your desired lifestyle as you plan for retirement, and methods to manage wealth and assets efficiently.
